titles.title: Advancing Research for Neurological Diseases Act of 2015
Advancing Research for Neurological Diseases Act of 2016

A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for systematic data collection and analysis and epidemiological research regarding Multiple Sclerosis (MS), Parkinson's disease, and other neurological diseases.
Advancing Research for Neurological Diseases Act of 2016

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

calendar.text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. Reported by Senator Alexander with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 408.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary:
Advancing Research for Neurological Diseases Act of 2016
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to improve the collection of epidemiological and surveillance data on neurological diseases and conditions. HHS may provide support to public or nonprofit entities for such purpose. Collected data must be made available for biomedical research.
